Name: New Age Spa

Review:
I've always had a great experience at New Age Spa, until yesterday.
I had purchased a Black Friday voucher for an Anti-Acne Facial Peel and made an appointment for the same. During the consultation, the aesthetician told me that it would be better to do a facial instead of the peel. She confirmed that the voucher I purchased was interchangeable for this service, and that there would not be a remaining balance to pay. Upon checkout, the receptionist told me that it doesn't work that way, and I would need to pay the difference.
I paid the balance and left but the situation was not sitting well with me. I reached out to the spa directly via email to try to resolve the situation. They replied that I should not have trusted what was said to me during the consultation, and that I should have read the FAQs. I'm very disappointed with their response and feel like I was blindsided. I understand that the aesthetician may have made a mistake, but at the very least I would have expected an apology, instead of the response I received.
I really loved this spa and now I feel like I can't go back.

Name: New Age Spa
Address: 2365 Saint-Patrick St. Suite #A5, Montreal, Quebec H3K 1B3
Review:
I‚Äôd like to share my true experience here with a micro needling facial. I went in for a facial with Devon, for a consult and micro needling. On the website it says they use B3 but instead she used this cheap low quality hyaluronic acid with bad Amazon reviews. I should‚Äôve walked out there but I trusted in the specialist right? To be clear I had perfect skin, never had acne issues growing up or dark spots, I just wanted to try the treatment to see what the hype was about. Well it turns out to be the biggest regret of my life, as when she did my facial she went over the same spot multiple times, bruised my face to filth! Felt like a tattoo. Even then I had high hopes, I was thinking she was a professional and surely knew what she was doing. WRONG! Trust your gut people, days past and I started getting break outs for the first time ever in my life, almost like a bacterial rash on the skin, weeks followed and more and more painful pimples. Once clear skin turns filled with dark spots, and management says I need to trust the ‚Äúprocess‚Äù and come back for more. How absolutely delusional, I had no issues with my skin and after Devon wrecks my face you‚Äôre saying another round will fix the problem ? They pay people to leave 5 star reviews and even had the audacity to email me the same offer. So never come here and if you do never see Devon !! I attached before the treatment and after 1.5 months of ‚Äúwaiting for it to heal‚Äù . She probably just messed up my skin on purpose so I can keep coming back to fix the problem. Evil !

Edit: since they responded to the review saying this can happen with ‚Äúacne prone skin‚Äù. Let me clarify that I‚Äôve never had acne in my life as I stated before. So if I‚Äôm having acne after the facial it is clearly acute (caused by the facial only) as for after care, it‚Äôs disappointing they‚Äôd try to say I didn‚Äôt follow the instructions to relive Devon of blame. Yes I followed every instruction, why wouldn‚Äôt I? Stop making excuses for your malpractice. As I said in the caption the circular things on my face are pimple patches, the photos are not fake. Take accountability for the damage you‚Äôve cause instead of blaming a client, a victim of your malpractice. I wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if the before and after photos on their website are showing the before pictures as the after, and really the after is the image they list as before.

Address: 2365 Saint-Patrick St. Suite #A5, Montreal, Quebec H3K 1B3
Review: I really wanted to like this place because it is clean/high-end and close-by to where I live. However several issues need to be stated which I attempted to resolve with them privately: 1) incessant text messages with forms to fill and texts, and calls multiple times per day which are very disruptive to people who work during the day. Clients should just have to fill out the form once and this form can apply to all appointments (as do all other spas) and clients should be able to opt-out out of receiving texts without needing to block the number and maintain ability to communicate with the spa. When I raised this issue with the receptionist she said there was no way to opt out of texts and that I had to block the number, but then I would not be able to communicate with the spa, in 2024 this really makes no sence. 2) arrived late one time (15-20 mins) and they were unable to accommodate me, however, once they were late and I just had to deal with it (which is OK, it happens, but then should be able to accommodate clients and 3) very expensive facial with gloves, i usually get facials at least 1/month and I've never had a facial with gloves and it was not enjoyable and when I asked the technician to remove gloves she said it was the policy. All this to say, would expect much better attention to client satisfaction in a business that is supposed to be centred on the client and with this many 5 star reviews. I've gone 4 times for laser and once for a facial, but now because of these issues I will find another place  to finish my laser and would not recommend this place.

Review:
I am impressed with my results.
3 weeks ago, I went for my laser hair removal below my arms and full bikini. It was my first session. Here is my result., I lost 20% of my hair in the bikini area and 50% under the arms. For a first session it's crazy and on top of that it didn't hurt at all. I am so happy with the result. I can't wait to go back on October 2. I recommend Age Spa!!! The best!!!

Name: New Age Spa
Address: 2365 Saint-Patrick St. Suite #A5, Montreal, Quebec H3K 1B3
Review: Before I read the reviews about the company, I must mention that they have two locations. I was served at the one in Verdun. The technician doesn't speak much French, mostly English. She was fine and took the time to see my skin from the start to advise me. I did microneedling, she told me that to get a result I would have to do it multiple times. So there was no result for me, in fact, a lot of pimples afterwards. The treatment doesn't hurt, but afterwards it's unpleasant. I was pressure-sold for products. It was really very insistent. She didn't tell me how to use them. It was when I called later in the evening that the operator at the clinic in Laval was able to answer my questions. Luckily she at least took the time to tell me not to take pain medication that would thin my blood. Nice clarification that I was not given during my treatment... Overall it cost me way too much for the experience I was given. I rather had the impression of being fooled, too.

I left feeling completely renewed, both physically and mentally. Highly recommend for anyone looking to unwind and indulge in a truly authentic spa experience!

Review:
Very rude people
I want to clarify that I would never leave a comment about a place without a valid experience. My reviews‚Äîwhether 1, 2, 4, or 5 stars‚Äîare always based on my actual experiences and reflect the service I received.

Regarding your establishment, my experience was disappointing. Your team appeared unprofessional, with members handling everything from massages to hair treatments and operating machines without the proper qualifications. This lack of specialization raises concerns about the quality and safety of the services provided.

And yes, maybe‚Äîlike most people‚ÄîI tend to share negative experiences more often than positive ones. However, I encourage you to take a closer look at the reviews your place has received. The majority are 1 or 2 stars, so perhaps instead of blaming me, it would be more productive to focus on addressing the recurring issues raised by multiple clients.

Review: I had a really nice experience at Zinabelle. It was my first time going to a hammam spa in Montreal. The staff was very friendly and answered all the questions I had prior to my visit. The staff made sure that I was comfortable and had an enjoyable experience. I definitely recommend the Berber Cure treatment for your first time, Jamila was great when giving the exfoliation service. The only thing that would have made the experience better would have been if there was a clock or something in scrub room. You are given a little break down of your treatment so I just felt a little worried not knowing if I was sticking to the time frame I was given. Overall great experience will be returning!!!

bonjour .On Wednesday, June 26, 2024, I had the privilege of visiting Zenabelle Clinique de Naturopathie during my stay in Montreal, marking my return to a hammam experience after more than a decade. The visit exceeded all expectations.

Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted at Zenabelle with a seamless blend of cordiality and professionalism, establishing a delightful tone for my visit. The exemplary customer service extended by each staff member demonstrated a sincere dedication not only to my comfort but also to ensuring my complete satisfaction. Their attentive and amiable demeanor created an atmosphere of genuine hospitality.

The ambiance at Zenabelle was truly exceptional‚Äîa serene and tranquil environment that fostered deep relaxation. The meticulously maintained facilities and meticulous attention to detail contributed significantly to an indulgent spa experience.

Drawing from my extensive background as a master coach specializing in customer service since 2010, I maintain discerning standards. Zenabelle unequivocally surpassed these benchmarks, deserving a definitive 5-star rating for their steadfast commitment to excellence and customer-centric approach.

It is crucial to emphasize that this review remains uninfluenced by any form of remuneration or incentive. My decision to enthusiastically endorse Zenabelle on my influential social media platforms (including TikTok and Instagram) stems purely from a genuine appreciation for the exceptional service and memorable experience they provided.

Furthermore, as a businessman, I believe Zenabelle Clinique de Naturopathie holds significant growth potential in the future. With the market not yet saturated, scaling the business could capitalize on ample opportunities.

I wholeheartedly recommend Zenabelle Clinique de Naturopathie for an enriching and superior spa retreat. Aziz. M

Review:
One word to describe Zinabelle‚Äôs naturopathy clinic experience, EXTRAORDINARY.

As a doctor and naturotherapist, I can only recommend the wonderful Dr. Serrar and her adorable team. From the moment I arrived, everyone took great care of me. The clinic decorated with a magnificent oriental style, which gives a unique character to the place while reinforcing the feeling of escape and well-being.

The service is impeccable, Dr. Serrar is very professional, kind, warm and very endearing. She listens and her advice is very specific.

My mother has already consulted Dr. Serrar in the past and we did not hesitate to drive 3 hours from Quebec City for a consultation.

I highly recommend the Zinabelle Clinic to anyone looking for a premium quality naturopathy experience.

Name: Hammam ZinaBelle Montreal & Clinique de Naturopathie
Address: 1955 Chem. de la C√¥te-de-Liesse #100, Saint-Laurent, QC H4N 3A8
Review:
I recently visited the Spa Hammam and had a complete and relaxing wellness experience. As soon as I arrived, the welcome was warm and the atmosphere calming, perfect for escaping from everyday life. The places are clean, elegant and immediately invite you to relax.

I opted for a complete treatment including a relaxing massage, a hydrating facial and a blow dry. Among all these steps, my favorite part was the deep exfoliation during the hammam. The feeling of purified and renewed skin is incomparable, and I really felt an immediate difference. Each treatment was carried out with great attention and impeccable professionalism, making the experience even more pleasant.

The setting, the calm atmosphere and the quality of the care offered make this place a true haven of peace. I recommend the Spa Hammam to those looking for a complete break in well-being. I left relaxed, recharged and with a feeling of lightness that I had not felt in a long time.

Name: Hammam ZinaBelle Montreal & Clinique de Naturopathie
Address: 1955 Chem. de la C√¥te-de-Liesse #100, Saint-Laurent, QC H4N 3A8
Review:
Following a disappointing experience, I would like to share my honest opinion.

I had booked a massage with a specific massage therapist, but once there, I was assigned another person without even informing me. When I made the comment, the staff ignored my request and acted as if nothing had happened.

In addition, the massage room was cluttered with unnecessary items (chair, extra bed, etc.), which detracted from the relaxing atmosphere that one expects in this type of place.

When I returned home, I discovered that the insurance receipt contained incorrect information: the number of sessions, the amount paid, and even the name of the massage therapist did not match.

When calling to correct the receipt, the owner instead proceeded to tell a series of unnecessary stories, including that she had ‚Äúgiven a warning‚Äù to an employee, simply because I had left a two-star review. Honestly, the internal organization of the clinic does not concern me: I am a client who has paid for a service, and I expect this service to be up to par.

In summary, if you are looking for a sensory massage with sound therapy and a place to truly relax, I strongly recommend this establishment, especially if you value details and professionalism.
Store_reply:

I really recommend!

Also, here is what I would have liked someone to tell me for my very first visit to a hammam... You have to see the hammam as a place to wash yourself: to sweat thoroughly in a steam bath to get rub the body to remove dead peaces. Afterwards, we soap ourselves and shower. You can then take the opportunity to wash your hair, apply a hair treatment, or make a moisturizing facial mask. In short, you have 1:30 to pamper yourself.

Bring: padlock for the locker, swimsuit or spare panties for the public hammam (you can be topless if you are comfortable), your body soap, shampoo and conditioner, washcloth, moisturizing mask or facial scrub if you feel like it!  my. Don't forget your pool sandals.

I will definitely go back!

Be careful!!! To all people who give their bank card information to guarantee the reservation at zinabelle be careful!!!!
the person who takes the reservation with the security deposit from your card risks stealing money from you a few days later.
I had the misfortune on September 24 to give my bank card information when booking with Zinabelle, the person I spoke to on the phone made me repeat the card numbers 3 times claiming to have made a mistake twice by entering the numbers into the system.
I realize 4 days later that 3 transactions have been made on my card for a total of 360 dollars for the ETSY online sales site.
I am 100% certain that my information was stolen during this reservation at Zinabelle because I rarely, almost never use this card, and it has not been used for at least 3 months before my visit to Zinabelle nor since. my visit to zinabelle.
The Hammam is a little expensive at over 360 dollars.
I will call management to report the person and hope they take the necessary steps.

From the moment you step into his office, you are met with warmth, professionalism, and an unwavering commitment to patient care. Name: Victoria Park Medispa - Westmount
Address: 376 Av. Victoria #400, Westmount, QC H3Z 1C3
Review:
I‚Äôve seen Dr. Nikolis for several treatments over the last year and a half. It‚Äôs been for Botox injections for medical reasons. The injections themselves were fine, and helpful, but at my last visit in October, I asked if he would be able to fill out some forms for my private insurance to request further coverage. I had previously asked his receptionist about this and she said it should be ok. I also asked about cost, because I know there‚Äôs usually a charge, which I would‚Äôve been ok with.

Anyway, I brought the forms in, with imaging reports, a list of previous treatments, the dates, and their efficacy. When I asked Dr. Nikolis if he would fill them out he answered weirdly defensively saying he couldn‚Äôt ‚Äúdo them today!‚Äù I hadn‚Äôt expected that. Then after some more uncomfortable discussion he said to me something along the lines of ‚Äúpeople don‚Äôt usually bring papers for insurance to a place like this.‚Äù That was really condescending and snobby.

I would understand if there was some policy about this, but I wasn‚Äôt able to find one, and I was never given a clear answer. I did leave the forms with his receptionist. I haven‚Äôt received anything from my insurance company, and I haven‚Äôt heard back from the receptionist after following up almost two weeks ago.

I would prefer to use my time to effectively improve my wellbeing, while also not paying $1000 to be spoken to by a defensive and haughty doctor.
Store_reply:
Dear Ms. Himmelman,

Thank you for your feedback. We were unable to access your Victoria Park Medispa ‚Ä¶ More

Name: Victoria Park Medispa - Westmount
Address: 376 Av. Victoria #400, Westmount, QC H3Z 1C3
Review:
I am extremely disappointed with my experience with Dr. Quynh Nguyen, ophthalmologist - Montreal situated at the Victoria park clinic .
I had trusted her expertise and chosen her for a cosmetic eye surgery, even following and supporting her practice on Instagram. However, my recent interaction has been nothing short of disheartening.

Out of desperation, I reached out to her for guidance regarding a rare and painful shingles case around my eye area. I sent detailed pictures and explained my condition when booking a consultation through her office. Despite this, when I arrived for my appointment, I was treated poorly.  The doctor refused to check my eyes and showed no empathy for my situation.

This experience left me feeling worse than when I walked in. If this was a case they couldn‚Äôt assist with, they could have easily informed me beforehand instead of stringing me along and wasting my time. Now, I‚Äôm forced to start over and find another ophthalmologist
This lack of professionalism and compassion is truly unacceptable. I expected better from someone I trusted, but this experience has left me incredibly disappointed.

Review:

Review:
My wife booked an appointment for a sebaceous cyst on my neck. When she called she was told the consultation was $150 which was right and that such an operation like mine was starting at $150, up to $300 or a bit more. She described the cyst precisely on size and looks.

I was greeted and immediately reassured by the dr's assistant it was only esthetic and not dangerous (that's the consultation) and they offered to remove it immediately.

As for the operation itself, it was $810, a complete different ballpark than what my wife was told. I wouldn't be complaining if my cyst was a golf ball size or if it was $100 more but we are talking over $1,100 with taxes, nowhere near expected amount. One of the person there told me the staff is trained only to say pricing starts at $X on phone and they didnt want to see a photo before, no wonder why.

A hugely disappointing experience. Clearly they are banking on your emotive side once you're inside.
Store_reply: We are sorry to hear of your disappointment M. Pelletier. Our Appointment Concierge Team can provide a range of prices, but the doctor alone can provide the proper diagnosis and treatment protocol for such a treatment. We are sorry if that ‚Ä¶ More

Name: Victoria Park Medispa - Westmount
Address: 376 Av. Victoria #400, Westmount, QC H3Z 1C3
Review:
Not impressed.  I can tell by the visit that it's a pure sales job.  I went for a consult for tired eyes and came out with a laundry list of items the doctor recommended- including my hair! Some of which haven't even been proven to work!
After my visit, I spoke to other friends who had gone elsewhere for consults and realized that most places give you a credit for the equivalent of the consult fee paid.  Had I known this, I would never had gone to Vicpark.  The consult is $150 for 20 minutes of someone's time and I did not get a credit not even partial credit.
Will I go here?  No simply because I can tell they don't have my interest in mind but more their pockets.  There are so many other spas in Montreal, and I found one where I know I will go.
I don't want to support a business who is in it for the money and not for the cause.

Review:
The space environment is very clean and welcoming. However I can't say the same for the staff. The receptionist was completely aloof. But she is not merely as bad as the technician I was scheduled with. Her name is Carolina I believe. She bared a steep amount of hostility and she was not amicable in the least. I smiled throughout the consultation but her catty attitude was only making me feel uncomfortable. I seriously wanted to leave.
Victoria Park also has a pointe Claire location which I HIGHLY recommend. Their staff and service are impeccable. I would trust my body to THEM.

Name: Victoria Park Medispa - Westmount
Address: 376 Av. Victoria #400, Westmount, QC H3Z 1C3
Review: Let me start by saying I have a had a number of treatments at the Victoria Park Medispa, Westmount location, and until now have always been extremely satisfied. The issue I am now having is purely administrative. I paid in advance for a treatment that I have had many times successfully at this location. When I arrived the technician said she didn't think that treatment was appropriate for me. I was very surprised but I trust her judgment. We had a quick conversation and parlayed the money I had already paid into an appointment for another (unrelated) treatment. At that time I told her I had issues with psoriasis in the area in question. She assured me it wouldn't be a problem. When I got home I read the website and it states that people with psoriasis should not get this treatment. I then visited my dermatologist and she advised against it. I cancelled the appointment weeks in advance. Everyone was polite there were no issues to till this point. When I cancelled my appointment the girl on the phone took my credit card number for a refund. I waited a few weeks but no refund. I called the office and say said they didn't do refunds on the credit card and instead would send me a cheque, a miscommunication but fine. I was told that my case was a bit complicated, for an administrative reason I don't quite understand, and that the operations manager would have to take care of it. I spoke with her and she said there would be a cheque waiting the next time I came into the office, planned for a week later. I arrived...no cheque. Caitlin called accounting and said that that cheque had not even be written yet. We are now at over three weeks from the time I cancelled the appointment. She assured me it would be sent at the end of the week and I would receive an email letting me know. She told me that I am not the only one who is having issues, everyone waiting for a refund is having issues. I don't find this particularly comforting. She was pleasant but I could tell I was irritating her. Yes, I have called a number of times to get an update on what is going on but this is over 1k I'm waiting for and each time I am given a date the date passes with no explanation. The end of the week comes and goes and no news. At the beginning of this week I called and left a message and I sent an email asking simply that they respond to me in writing to let me know the total amount and when I can reasonably expect the refund to be sent. Literally, no response. I certainly understand there is only so much Caitlin can do and she is not personally responsible for sending out refunds. I really don't like having to call repeatedly and make a nuisance of myself. It has now been almost 6 weeks since I requested a refund. I am unsure of where to go from here and the lack of accurate information is unsettling. It would be great if someone could get back to me, preferably in writing, with an accurate update. Again, I am not laying blame on any particular person. This is one of those unfortunate administrative hiccups that happen, we merely need to find a solution in a timely manner and communicate it effectively.
Store_reply: Hello Amanda. We are very sorry that processing your refund took longer than expected, and we can certainly understand how frustrating this must have been. Since the initial treatment cost was transferred onto a prepaid card and ‚Ä¶ More

Name: Victoria Park Medispa - Westmount
Address: 376 Av. Victoria #400, Westmount, QC H3Z 1C3
Review: I went here to get highlights and lowlights and I would not go back if they paid me. The first time I left I had a few zebra stripes and my roots were still showing, I asked her to make it look natural and it was far from being natural. I called and went back a second time and it certainly did not help. The hairdresser I had clearly knows nothing about highlights or what lowlights even are, I told her I was not happy with the appearance as there were still roots showing and thick bleach blonde stripes and she tried to justify it saying it did not look bad and that she tried her best. I wish I had asked for my money back, they offered for me to go in a third time in one week. Hah! My scalp is in enough pain and I don't want all my hair to fall out. Never again!

Name: Victoria Park Medispa - Westmount
Address: 376 Av. Victoria #400, Westmount, QC H3Z 1C3
Review:
Good morning,

I received service on August 6 and September 18, the BELA. I am now writing for August 6, because I gave the chance a second time on September 18 and believing that I was going to have another technician because I had asked the receptionist. Brief.
Extremely dissatisfied with the dragging received by the technician who spent half the time outside the room (both dates). Concerning September 18, I arrived at 12:55 p.m., my appointment is at 1:00 p.m. The technician arrives at 1:05 p.m. to pick me up. We begin the treatment, with the machine, with the 3 or 4 steps (fairly quick). No extraction done by the technician, when I know very well that I have a lot to do. The first time she did it but it was quite light. During these treatments, there is red light and a mask. During these two stages, she leaves you alone in the room, which is completely unhygienic, walks in and out, touches the door handles and probably makes other stains outside, which disgusts me greatly, because it It‚Äôs still my face that people touch. I travel across the
world and receives the most refined treatments in beautiful aesthetic centers, you are never left alone in the room. That said, the treatment on September 18 ends at 1:50 p.m....and on August 6, it lasted 60 minutes, it's only because she left me almost 15-20 minutes with the mask alone in the room, so If you calculate correctly, it's about 45 minutes of treatment for $260 and what's more, we dare ask you for a tip. I'm quite shy at these times, so I still gave an amount of money. I left disgusted and frustrated. I have been a customer since the very beginning of your center, I have spent thousands, and I have never been so dissatisfied with these last two services that I received. I obviously had to go back to a beautician to redo the work.
Store_reply:
Hello Ms. Gareau,
I hope this message finds you in good health. I would like to sincerely apologize to you for the experience you had at our clinic. Your comments are very ‚Ä¶ More

Name: Victoria Park Medispa - Westmount

Review:
I've been going to Victoria Park Westmount for BBL several times now. Great receptionist service. As for the laser treatment it was ok...however when it came time to pay, I had quite a surprise!! First, I was told that they took prepaid Visa gift cards: after trying the card several times, it never worked. I knew that the clinic reserves an extra $38 if you pay in part with a prepaid card and no one knew about it!!
Then, the technician who seemed impatient, clearly told me that I had to leave a tip!!!????? Yet they are not paid with a tipped salary so why demand it? (for a 25 min treatment... at $500 + 15% tip) we agree that it's completely ridiculous!!!!!!!!!!!! I spend several dollars for other treatments in Laval and NEVER have anyone asked for a tip and I even asked other clients and they all told me that they never even thought it was necessary .. imagine a tip on a botox treatment ect.. 2000$ + 15% ü§®. Unfortunately, I will continue the treatments in Laval only
Store_reply: Thank you for your comment Ms. Mayrand. We apologize for the inconvenience caused by paying by prepaid card. We can assure you that this will not happen again. In addition, tipping is not required and remains at the customer's discretion. ‚Ä¶ More

Review:
Good morning,

I joined Victoria Park because my dermatologist for 19 years and my sister for 15 years, Dr. Madeleine Gagnon, has become indispensable to us in our lives. Dr. Gagnon is so professional. Our file is always updated the day before our appointment. Its objective is to look natural, taking into account our face. She won't do anything that doesn't suit us, there's no point in insisting. In complete safety, I have been seeing her at least every 6 months for 19 years. No problem.  Still excited by the result. Dr Gagnon is a painter, his eye is skilled at improving, highlighting our features and making us beautiful!  Despite depressed periods in my life, she always knew how to cheer me up.  It's impossible to do without her! She is constantly improving! The service is so personalized, its employees so exceptional that I couldn't believe you have employees of this high level!

Well yes, M√©lanie Cloutier is extraordinary. She embodies the personalized service that my sister Sylvie and I love so much.

With complete confidence we left our faces in his skillful hands. I had a Halo treatment on October 2 and I'm going back to see her for a second one on January 3, 2020! Same thing for my sister.

I congratulate Victoria Park human resources for finding this gem!!!

We serve happy customers until the end. Indeed, finishing beautiful is our retirement goal!
And we hope to live a very long time and not look our age!
Please forward the message to your clinic in Laval

Sincerely,

Jocelyne and Sylvie Lussier
Clinic in Laval
Dr Madeleine Gagnon

It was so painful, it hurt the nerves in my teeth and later in the day it hurt to even brush them. It also gave me a massive headache. I think if this had been mentioned in the website description I would have not booked this type. Perhaps this is super common with a facial? Like I said it has been several years since my last one so maybe this is an expected treatment. I was just very taken aback by it.

Name: Reimagine Clinic

Review:
UPDATE:
After expressing my concerns about the inconvenience caused by their machine issues, Shannon mentioned the possibility of legal action in response to my review. Shannon also updated her response to my initial review to claim she had tried to reschedule my appointment due to the machine incident, but this is not accurate. I was only informed about rescheduling when I was already at the clinic, with the option to wait until a new machine arrived‚Äîsomething that would disrupt my treatment schedule.

No alternative was offered to address how this situation impacted my treatment plan. I found this response disappointing. I encourage anyone considering this clinic to take my experience into account. I stand by my review and will await any further actions from the clinic.

-------------------

I had a poor experience at this clinic. My laser hair removal appointments were rescheduled multiple times; I was understanding for the first two changes, but the third reschedule was pushed out two weeks due to a broken machine. I wasn‚Äôt informed in advance, and the session was canceled only after I arrived at the clinic, even though they knew the machine wasn‚Äôt working. I was concerned about delayed results from missing a session during the correct Anagen phase, but I received no assurance on how this delay might impact my outcome, nor any resolution for the inconvenience.

Additionally, I noticed they offer incentives for positive reviews, which may impact the balance of feedback on this clinic. Given my experience, I personally wouldn‚Äôt recommend this clinic.
Store_reply: We would like to address some inaccuracies. Shannon did contact you to reschedule your appointment due to a temporary technical issue with our laser equipment, which we communicated to you in advance. You can be honest about that fact! ‚Ä¶ More

I  completed a classic facial there and am not happy with the results. First impressions was really bad since they accused me of going 2 hrs early while I was on time and I arrived 15 min before my appointment. The entire session was only 30 minutes! Please beware of that because it's not mentioned on their website. Usually all facials that I received at other locations are at least 1 hour long and they do multiple steps of opening your pores, cleansing, extraction and applying 2-3 serums and masks plus an SPF Sunscreen at the end so as a result once you come out of the salon your skin feels soft and you would be glowing for the next few days!  Also, the salon does not have a relaxing vibe. No music and no privacy as the other personnel would pop their head from time to time.  There is also a lack of focused light and magnifying glass to look at your skin more closely. Therefore, the extractions were not done properly. Again comparing to other places this would be a waste of time, energy and money. Fancy places like Spas in Old port do a complete facial in 1 hour for the same price in a more relaxing and professional environment with better products.

Based on my painful experience and my skin makes me feel ashamed and humiliated after their treatments,they know nothing!!!!! I‚Äôm bravely speaking out to warn everyone: don‚Äôt be deceived and waste a large amount of money in this clinique.
I spent at least $20,000 at their clinic and tried treatment she recommended 3-5 times , with some treatments done up 10 times. Each time, there was no effect at all.  I always believed what she said, deceiving myself with hope and illusions for the next treatment. All the Five-start reviews here are fake, and she knows it!!
I was a loyal customer of this clinic for over two years and underwent treatments for acne scars and pigmentation removal there. Initially, I only had a few acne scars, but after several treatments (once every 1-2 months, totaling 5-10 sessions), my skin ended up with over 50 pits. As for pigmentation removal, after 5-10 sessions, there was no lightening or improvement whatsoever.

That‚Äôs why I wrote this letter to them, and below is the response I received from their clinic a few days later. For privacy reasons, I do not want to share my photos. Every time she saw me, she could clearly see the uneven, scarred condition of my face. Yet now, after everything, they have the audacity to demand I send them my private photos. Their behavior is truly overbearing and excessive, showing absolutely no respect for ethics or legal boundaries.

I‚Äôm correcting my old review and giving 2 stars only because of Nayia, whose work I appreciate and whom I‚Äôve come to know as a genuine person over the years. Otherwise, my experience would warrant just 1 star.

After more than 4 years of loyalty‚Äîvisiting at least once a month‚ÄîI‚Äôm extremely disappointed with how the establishment handled 2 involuntary no-shows. Despite calling both times to explain last-minute emergencies and offering to pay the missed appointment fees at my next visit. I was met with a rigid ‚Äúnew mandatory policy.‚Äù They claimed that the system wouldn‚Äôt allow them to book an appointment without a credit card on file (which I‚Äôm not really comfortable giving) or prepayment (which is absurd). However, the receptionist had already booked my appointment, and I even received the system‚Äôs booking confirmation, proving this isn‚Äôt a technical necessity and contradicts their claim (as proven in picture below).

Over the years, I‚Äôve purchased several of their recommended products‚Äînone of which worked as promised‚Äîand never once complained. I remained incredibly patient, willing to continue treatments despite limited results because I truly had faith in their services. I‚Äôve spent a significant amount of money at their establishment, doing full-body laser hair removal‚Äînot just one body part‚Äîalong with facials and even hormonal testing. I wasn‚Äôt trying to ‚Äúcheapen out‚Äù; I invested heavily in their services and trusted their recommendations, even as I continued to experience hair growth after OVER 18 laser sessions.

Name: Dermamode

Review:
I've been with Dermamode for over a year now, where I've been doing laser hair removal. I'm completely amazed with the results, but I cannot be more pleased with the staff at Dermamode.

The girls at the front desk are incredibly polite and courteous. They've accommodated me so many times despite the fact that I have a pretty tight schedule myself. They're awesome!

As for the technicians, the girls are incredibly sweet, very professional and friendly. I've had my laser done by a few different technicians, but the service has always been amazing. The girls are so passionate about what they do, and if I had any special requests to ask, they would always listen and make sure I'm happy and satisfied :)

Review: I had the facial prp 2 times with Jackie and cannot recommend it enough. You fill in a medical check and the first time I was feeling a bit under the weather she offered me to reschedule to make sure I would take the treatment well. She is so professional & lovely, with precise, gentle gestures you know you're in good hands. The procedure took around 2hrs total because I'm sensitive and asked for extra numbing cream which is no issue. I got swollen, bled a little and small bruising but it is normal and all gone in 24hrs after when you can wash your face. The first time I didn't see much result but still felt good so I came back for a second (4 is recommended to start, then one every few months), and I got a perfectly smoothed forehead right away, as if I had done Botox. I think it'll be good for my dark circles even if they can't completely go away, it's basically risk free procedure. This is the area where I couldn't even feel the needle so if youre scared when getting close to the eyes like I was don't worry, it's my crows' feet I felt more (but still entirely bearable). Jackie has such an aura of serene confidence and the place so clean & welcoming I would definitely come back for other treatments.

Review: I moved to Montreal last year and was initially looking for a hair removal clinic to continue laser treatment on my face. I booked my consultation with Audrey at Dermamode and was pleasantly surprised that she was able to offer an alternative solution that she believed would be more effective and less expensive than laser to get rid of those last few stubborn hairs left from the previous treatments. The amazing thing is that she could have easily chose to make a larger sale and continue laser treatments on me but was actually so honest and professional that she recommended what was best for me, the customer :) I'd previously had electrolysis done in other areas of my body so was already aware of how amazing the results can be but had never thought to complete the hair removal on my face with this..the last few years I've had multiple treatments on my face from IPL, waxing, threading, bleaching and even shaving! I've had a good few treatments with Audrey over the last few months and I'm very happy to say my traumatic hairy face ordeal is almost over! And not only has the treatment been successful, but all the staff are super friendly and professional, the environment is clean and they have electrolysis packages to allow you to save money if you're looking for multiple treatments over time. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a permanent hair removal solution with a great service!

Name: Dermamode
Address: RC, 1001 Rue Saint-Antoine O Suite 110, Montreal, Quebec H3C 4T7
Review: I came here for electrolysis treatments in 2016 and have been disappointed with my experience unfortunately. The technician I had was really nice and super sweet (can't remember her name) which is the only reason I am giving two stars instead of one, and I went for numerous treatments here which ended up leaving 2 pretty noticeable dented hole marks on my face. I was told it was going to go away within a couple months when I first saw the first one and was very concerned, but it never did, and a few treatments later a second permanent scar was made in my skin by the needle. A dermatologist I went to inquiring about how to fix that said we could try fillers, but it wouldn't fully do anything really and that there was no real way to do undo this as it is a permanent scarring, which is pretty upsetting. He also said "how big was the needle they used?!' Apparently that is not a common thing to happen I guess. I have wanted to continue treatments ever since but have stopped going after the technician scarred me that second time and the last one still wasn't diminishing as I was told it would, and years later they are as noticeable as the first day she made them. I'm not sure if she was trying to lie about the fact they would be permanent scars or if she really didn't know and assumed they would go away on their own but I'm at last glad I stopped going to her for treatments for that reason. So at least I only have two scar holes on my face instead of more but it is something that has bothered me alot and why I have been afraid to continue with electrolysis. I also have blonde hair so laser wouldn't work for me and IPL never worked when I tried it elsewhere 10 years ago either. Not sure what to do about this but to say it has been a disappointing experience would be an understatement. Wish I could say I had the great results and experience everyone else seemed to have here as the great reviews was the reason I picked this place to go to in the first place.
Store_reply:
Good afternoon,

As always, we'd like to thank you for bringing this to our attention; in this ‚Ä¶ More

Address: RC, 1001 Rue Saint-Antoine O Suite 110, Montreal, Quebec H3C 4T7
Review: I had electrolysis here and I regret it.  I told them I was worried about scarring from electrolysis which a lot of women get.  They told me that this was because estheticians used too high a voltage or something to that effect and that they didn't do that.  I was shocked to find that after 3 treatments, I was getting this same scarring on my upper lip where  I received the treatments.  The esthetician told me it was "large pores" but I didn't have any before I started the treatments here.  Also, the hair removal wasn't very permanent and I had to restart tweezing it.  Not worth the time or money and may do more harm than good.

On the other hand, for the permanent laser hair removal service, I am personally very disappointed with the results. During my telephone consultation session the lady sold me a bit of the dream on effectiveness by sharing her experience and how she could ‚Äúcount on one hand the hair she had after 6 sessions‚Äù and how to charge a little more may be worth it. I too hastily took the pack for an absolutely staggering price when I compare today with other institutes (and supposedly it was on sale‚Ä¶). Also, let's not talk about the price of touch-ups... In short, for hair removal I sincerely advise you to look elsewhere or at least not to commit too quickly because, having tried elsewhere, I can tell you that This service is absolutely not worth it.

Name: Clinique Corps Id√©al - Ideal Body Clinic - Monkland
Address: 6000 Monkland Ave, Montreal, Quebec H4A 1G8
Review: Don't ever pay for their lipolaser or any other body contouring treatment at this clinic. They are all scams and they don't yield any result, not even imaginary ones. Sadly I can't give 0 stars so they get to have that one. Worst place ever. I paid to have 5 sessions at 469,50$ and only did 2 of them. When I said that I was unsatisfied with the results and wanted a refund for the 3 sessions I did not take yet, they told me they don't give refund and that I could have store credits or other products. Then I said I wasn't interested in anything else. At first, they stopped replying to my emails for one week hoping that I would just go away. But I called and persisted, even thought the manager did everything to avoid me and always used clueless employees as shield. And there is no number nor email to contact the manager at all. Finally they came up with an offer: they would charge me plain price for the 2 sessions I took because the offer of 5 sessions was at a promotional price when I paid and they would substract it from the 469,50$ I paid initially and that 1 session at plain price was 180+taxes so the 2 would be 360+taxes and I would only be refunded 49$. With that logic it means that if I took 3 on the 5 sessions I paid for instead and asked for a refund I would be the one owing them money for being dissatisfied. Of course I asked them what kind of logic was that and I said that if I paid at promotional price I wanted a refund at promotional price. And then they recontacted me saying that they negociated a better arrangement. They said that they could only refund me for 2 session's price instead of the 3 on 5 sessions I did not take yet, the reason being that since I want a refund, the price of 1 session would be used as my "processing fees". Some more nonsense just to not give me my money üòÇ but at that point I was fed up and accepted. And I also forgot I signed a contract with them that said "no refund" on it so I did not want to argue. But that no refund contract is assuming that the treatments hold any type of value and are not total scams that do not work as advertised right? So in the end, I would have settled for a 181$ refund until they sent me a refund contract with a clause of non denigration in which I would have to never talk about them  whether it's online or in real life and never tell anyone about my experience with them to protect their reputation üòÇ. I told them I would only sign that contract for a full refund not for a measly 100$ and they told me they were offering me this partial refund of 181$ and keeping the 90$ of the 3rd session because of "processing fees" as a token of good faith and that anyways I signed a no refund contract and they don't owe me anything even thought when I signed I did not know it was a scam. They would do anything to keep every dollar possible from lying to inventing inexisting "processing fees" and illogical new rules. Once you swipe your card for a payment there, your money is lost forever. I would never recommend this place for anything. They only show their true face to you when they already took your money and know you are never coming back. For example I could never get in touch with the "manager" or whoever rules there for days even though they promised me I would receive a call later everytime because he/she was "busy" with clients. When I told them that I've been a client for months since I paid too and as such should be prioritized too they were speechless. What they meant to say is that they knew I was never coming back there to give them my money again so the manager does not care whether I am satisfied or not. I am just waiting to see what they will reply to that review üòÇ

Name: Clinique Corps Id√©al - Ideal Body Clinic - Monkland
Address: 6000 Monkland Ave, Montreal, Quebec H4A 1G8
Review:
I recently visited Ideal Body Clinic for botox injection as my dermatologist was on holiday, and I wanted to give this place a try.

I will never go back. Here are some of the reasons why:

1- The ambiance is chaotic, they don't seem to know who has appointments, who is a new or returning client.
2- The reception area is messy , there aren't enough chairs, it is dirty and disorganised.
3- Reception staff are inexeperienced and unprofessional, it seemed that every intereaction they had with any client was problematic and unclear.
4- Most staff interactions with clients were rude.
5- I was ordered around, asked several times why I was there, who my appointment was with, where my form was, and why I was sitting where I was sitting. Basically, they have no idea what is happening. I was asked to move to different rooms, before seeing the doctor for the consultation.  Up the stairs , down the stairs, go here, sit there, why are you in here? , go wait downstairs... completely choatic.
6- The doctor was ''fine'', although we were interrupted at least 3 times by various staff members asking questions and divulging information about other clients to the doctor in front of me!  Truly unprofessional.
7- After nealry an hour of being shuffled around, I was finally seen by the nurse/injectables person, and agreeing on the amout of units she litterally stabbed the needle in.  When my dermatologist does it, it is painless.  After the injections here I had lumps, bled, and still have bruises 3 days later.
8- Their pricing is complicated and unclear: rebate codes, ''specials'' it seems like they make it up as they go along.

I will stick with my dermatologist.  I would rather pay slightly more... because this place is not worth it.

Review:
I initially contacted the business by e-mail asking if they injected a very specific muscle called the pterygoid muscle. I was told yes, they did, and proceeded to make an appointment for a free consultation. When I arrived at the facility I filled out all the paperwork and put a credit card on file. I was told that after the consultation with the injector, I would have to have another consultation with the doctor (due to government requirements) in which there was a fee of $130. They told me the Doctor was not on site, and that the nurse would call her from her phone and hand the phone to me. This seemed very shady and unprofessional.  During my initial free consultation with the nurse, she told me they did not inject the ptyergoid muscles as I was initially told, but that they did all the other muscles.  I became very uncomfortable with their business practices and the fact that they lied about their services to get me through the door and then tried to trap me into services. I immediately left the business and did not proceed with the $130 consultation with the doctor as I had no intentions on proceeding with any services however I was still charged for that service. I tried to contact the business for a refund without success. I demand a refund for the service that was never rendered.

In response to owner:
Confirm how you would like for me to privately contact you? I have called numerous times and also sent an e-mail, each time with no return calls or e-mails. What else can I do?

Update 03/03/24
I am still waiting for the refund you promised me a few months ago. I have contacted your office by phone and e-mail over one dozen times.

Name: Clinique Corps Id√©al - Ideal Body Clinic - Monkland
Address: 6000 Monkland Ave, Montreal, Quebec H4A 1G8
Review:
Ideal body clinic is a great place to get laser hair removal done they are always having deals. They have amazing hours too they close at 9 so you can go after work or school. I would recommend full body if you‚Äôre in the market. My sessions where an hour and a half on average. ‚ÄºÔ∏è but their numbing cream IS A MUSTTT it‚Äôs 60 bucks but money well spent you don‚Äôt need a lot and just need to put it on sensitive areas 30 minutes before.I recommend to put it anywhere where you‚Äôre lasering on your face,armpits,bikini and butt crack‚ÄºÔ∏è Get prepared to spend a good hour shaving because that‚Äôs all you‚Äôre allowed to do and they don‚Äôt do the shaving for you.I started with fatona laser and when switched to Darwin. The difference is that fatona is an elevated laser on dry skin and therefore better when your hair is thicker but it‚Äôs more painful. But the fatona and a cooling part attached to the laser which makes it less painful. Darwin is directly on the skin but there‚Äôs a layer of very messy gel. This gel protects the skin and makes the laser glide. I am a bit disappointed that they kept switching aestheticians on me. these are the aestheticians I had. ( I am missing one because I can‚Äôt remember her name)
Anna- only works at night very good and non apologetic she‚Äôs there to do her job and do it right. Not afraid to higher the intensity of the laser. (There to give you the best results) tiana- super kind and a bit timid she always asks if you‚Äôre ok. She‚Äôs a bit afraid to higher the intensity of the laser. Because it will cause you pain.
Sara- only had her once she was really good. She had laser done on her self so you knows what it‚Äôs like and is very mindful but also confident in what she is doing.
Natalia- only works during the day she‚Äôs amazing she‚Äôs been doing her job for over 11 years she has lots of experience and she works with men too. So nothing surprises her. Over all they are very accommodating but it was just disappointing that they kept changing it up seeing as you‚Äôre showing your full body to professionals but in the end strangers.
Store_reply: Thank you for the review Chaya, and for being a great client!

Name: Clinique Corps Id√©al - Ideal Body Clinic - Monkland
Address: 6000 Monkland Ave, Montreal, Quebec H4A 1G8
Review:
Do not go here it's a scam!! My sister and I went here for eight sessions of laser hair removal and it only worked about 50% for both of us ‚Äì we still have hair left. We now have to go to Victoria Park to finish the other 50%. The technician had been using the machine at a lower intensity so as to make it less painful for us, but she did not tell us that using it at a lower intensity made the treatment less effective (we just figured she had to pass the machine over the target areas a few more times at the lower intensity, she did not explain to us that it is less effective). Why would we go through a process that was still painful even at the lower intensity only to not see any results at the end? It's the technician's job to explain how the process works and make sure it is done effectively, but she did not do this. We were only told about the reduced efficacy of the lower intensity when we called to complain that the treatment was not working and we wanted our money back. The manager refused to speak to us or return our calls, so clearly they do not even care about their business ‚Äì extremely rude and disrespectful. The secretary offered us an extra session, but why would we accept another session of a treatment that doesn't work?? Don't go here: the technician does not know how to deliver effective treatment (or at the very least to communicate about it, but who knows, maybe she didn't even know that lower intensity was less effective since it was the secretary who told us this, not the technician) and the manager is rude and clearly doesn't care about their business. What a waste of time and money.

In response to the owner's response: yes it's true you spoke to my mother but I was in the room when she was on the phone every time she called and she BEGGED to have a manager called her back and no manager ever did. So please do not call your customer a liar... it's not a good look for your business. Also, my sister and I never tanned. Neither of us use self-tanner, nor have we ever. We have barely left the house since March 2020 because of covid, so we actually did not even tan in the summer and we certainly were not tanned in the freezing Montreal winter. For people reading this review, for reference, my foundation shade at MAC is NW18 (I wore it throughout summer 2020, fall 2020 and winter 2021 because I didn't darken because I was inside all the time), and my sister is basically the same, so if that's tan then I honestly don't know who your service works on. Also, I am 21 and my sister is 18, so clearly you didn't even read my file right. Both of us have also had many friends our age do laser hair removal at other clinics and it worked perfectly for ALL of them, so it's just not true that being younger affects it. I know you offered us extra sessions, but why would we accept more of a service that doesn't work? If you don't want to refund us in any capacity, that's totally fine, but I just want to let other people know not to waste their money like my sister and I did. I wish you all the luck in improving your business.
Store_reply: We‚Äôre sorry to hear about your disappointment, but we would like to clarify a few points in response to your review. Our communication was actually with your mother, not with you or your sister. It seems there may have been a ‚Ä¶ More

Name: Clinique Corps Id√©al - Ideal Body Clinic - Monkland
Address: 6000 Monkland Ave, Montreal, Quebec H4A 1G8
Review:
I'll begin by saying that this was the worst customer service experience I've ever had in my entire life. If I could give 0 stars I would.
I had purchased a Groupon deal for laser hair removal in September & went for my first treatment. I am half black, half white & I'm a 4 on the fitzpatrick scale; meaning I need specific lasers but I didn't know this prior (any trained tech is supposed to know this). The tech (initial "M") was kind and continuously asked if I was fine when I was having my treatment. It hurt a A LOT. I had laser treatments before but assumed the amount of pain was normal because the machine looked older.

The next day I burned and the day after I went back to Ideal body to let them know ask how I should take care of them. The head tech, Julia, asked M if everything was done correctly (lowest temp, gel applied, etc.) and M and I told her that she took all necessary steps. So I went back on October 31 for my second appointment, this time with Julia. This woman brings me to THE EXACT SAME MACHINE that burned me!? She said "I wouldn't burn with her". I told Julia, and she should already know this, that it wasn't M's fault, but that the machine is too strong for my skin type. After doing research before my appointment, I told her that the best laser for dark skin is a Diode or YAG (this is FACT). Julia insists I try the laser again 'because I burned due to the last tech', but Julia KNEW "M" did everything she was supposed to. M was a great tech and I was disappointment that Julia was snakey enough to try to blame her colleague but also stupid enough to blame a colleague after all three of us confirmed together that it wasn't  M's fault, but the machine?

I'm getting upset and Julia finally brings me to the owner, Veronika, who is sitting in the lobby in a chair. I ask her if we could speak in a more private setting as I'm about to bring up the burns (and didn't want to scare any customers in the lobby) and she said she does not want to move because she is comfortable. Okay. So I proceed to explain how I need a different machine than the one that burned me, or a refund and Veronika said it would cost me $400 MORE to use the YAG. I decline as the Groupon already cost me $310 and I was not ready to pour any more money into a business who seemingly does not care about their clients.
I obviously decline and request a refund and Veronika denies my request. I tell her that Groupon will issue a refund if the salon deems that I'm not a suitable candidate and since I burned from the treatment, I'm pretty sure I would not be considered a suitable candidate.
Guys, I'm really standing in this hallway having to explain to a grown woman how burns are painful, I'm scarred from their machine and I'm not continuing with my treatments. The owner asks me to come into the hallway to show her my burns, I do so and she ACTUALLY ASKS "how do we know those were because of us?". I'm now livid and say "check your file" and instead of doing so, Veronika turns to Julia and says "did you see any burns?" If Julia lied at this point I was going to be suing lol. Julia tells the truth and admits that I had burned and come in after but that "the burning is normal." Well, let me tell you, BURNING IS NOT NORMAL FOR LASER AND ANY TECH WHO THINKS SO SHOULDN'T BE WORKING AS A TECH.

Defeated, Veronika says I can get into contact with Groupon. As I'm leaving the salon, all three of the young receptionists are whispering as they look at my file together (extremely unprofessional). Still, at least SOMEBODY finally checked my file.
I filed a complaint with Groupon and they refunded me but I never went into the salon to refund my taxes ($40+)  they can keep it, they obviously need it after the hassle they gave me over a refund.
Just check how Ideal Body handles the negative reviews, instead of trying to remediate the customer, they blame the customer.
If you decide to do business at ideal Body, best of luck to you.
*reply to comment: You guys INSISTED I try the same machine & offered a treatment that cost more than DOUBLE what I already paid. No.
Store_reply:
Hello,
We are glad to receive a review from your part. ‚Ä¶ More

Seeing all these positive reviews, I can't help but wonder if they are posted by staff/friends of the owners.
Their business is run off of offers like Groupon (never a good sign when you have to heavily discount your services and don't get return busines), and they don't even honour the fine print they advertise.
I bought a laser hair removal package and it was a huge waste of time and money. If the people performing the treatments really are certified estheticans, which I doubt, they definitely need refresher courses. For example, their IPL machine would heat my skin and I would feel like I was going to be burned, even though they used low settings. This never occurred elsewhere I had treatments. Turns out the machine needs to be on for at least 5 minutes for the cooling tip to have a chance to be effective, and at my treatments, they flipped the machine on and started immediately. Even after I showed them their own manual they refused to respect how the machine should be used!  And they wanted to ice my skin instead,  applying an ice pack directly to my skin which isn't supposed to be done.
Because they didn't use the machine properly, the setting was kept very low, and I did a year of treatments for nothing. I have seen more dramatic change after one treatment elsewhere than I did after a year of treatments here.

What a scam and waste of time!  They should be ashamed.
Store_reply:
Dear Aura,
We are sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with the provided service. However, on our part, we can guarantee that all estheticians who practice laser hair ‚Ä¶ More

I had messaged the spa to confirm they accept wayspa gift cards but wasn‚Äôt told that there were services that were not included with wayspa until after I drove an hour to get to the spa. On the wayspa website it says medi-spa is part of the offered services. Here‚Äôs what online says is the definition of medi-spa:

Medical spas, sometimes called medi-spas or med spas, are establishments that offer various medical procedures in a luxurious ambience. Imagine the tranquillity of a spa, paired with the expertise of a licensed medical practitioner.

So if way-spa says medi-spa how am I to know that doesn‚Äôt include injections or medical consultation unless I am informed by the establishment? It was frustrating and disappointing.

And proof that Veronica really has a nursing injector diploma would be good too. Excuses are too easy for a supposedly professional position.

Review: I feel cheated, I am of the same opinion as Lise Normand Laroche (read below)..I had A Groupon coupon..I am going to demand a refund....that can't be done. I have been around the block twice And fifteen minutes later by chance I found ONE door unlocked...they are placed so as not to be inspected...not at all professional...when you are sitting ready for your injections...Veronica announces that for better to do that will take the other injections stronger than that of your Groupon around the mouth .... for the modest sum of 450.00 Plus ... It's that or YOU √± have no concrete results ... that got me cost in total 700.00 And I have no results Only p bumpy titles Here and there...I went elsewhere last year And the result was wow? Why did I drive four hours there and back to go to Ideal...and much less expensive with Groupon...I was received like A dog in a bowling game...we don't understand anything she says ...no recommendations at the end...before photo I don't know why you don't have one afterwards...they make you fill out sheets with irrelevant questions about your health...that she never looked at. ...But The Worst And I Fooled....The receptionist who twice needed to speak to Veronica came knocking at Our door And horror She opened with A glove on One hand And The syringe on the other.. ..twice...imagine THE bacteria from the doorknob in my pricked face Plus...I would have cried...The moral of this story If you don't have the means to pay for appropriate treatments a full price...go for it, it hurts less in the heart And your wallet....But I have to tell my credit that I trusted Groupon..and that too It's serious.....But that we won't stop there...for me I saw it as A scam...P.S I had to demand when I took out everything that I had been given on paper and I did an exhaustive search to realize that it was not that's what she told me when I made my reservation...I asked her if the product was Juviderme and she told me yes and that it came from France...but it's Teosyal for the lips...and probably diluted in their case

As much as I've loved having my Botox and fillers done by my dermatologist - I will no longer be going to her for these procedures.

You need to give these folks a try - you won't be disappointed.

Name: Skin Vitality Medical Clinic Toronto
Address: 351 Eglinton Ave W, Toronto, ON M5N 1A3
Review: Embarrassingly unprofessional. I‚Äôve previously left a positive review but as a repeat customer who has spent $1000‚Äôs of dollars here, I have changed my opinion. Maybe it‚Äôs because of the high turnover of staff but I dealt with all new people at my last appointment. Way too many staff behind the counter to greet you, yet they were not very informative or friendly, seems their only job is to look you up and down upon arrival and obtain health info. Giving 2* for the cleanliness and ease of getting an appointment (which should be a telling sign in itself). However, very unprofessional. The consultant didn‚Äôt seem very knowledgeable, so other than offering promotions, not sure what her job is. She recommended over 80 units of dysport, which was either over diluted (they have a reputation for this which I chose to ignore), or grossly insufficient. Yet, I‚Äôve never had this much injected before and have had better results with less at other clinics. Soon after my appointment, the consultant emailed and called several times to say SHE made a mistake and undercharged me $9. It seemed very petty and off putting to expect a repeat customer who has spent a lot of money there to be harassed for someone else‚Äôs mistake and especially for such a nominal amount. My daughter also comes here for her lips, so they basically lost 2 customers over hounding me for their $9 mistake. Not professional at all. Not satisfied with the results either this time and although my daughter returned after her last visit because her lips where uneven, all they offered was to dissolve it rather than fix the asymmetry that they caused. If you‚Äôre on a budget and looking for good promotions- this may be your place, but it‚Äôs costing me more to now go somewhere else to add more dysport. But beware, the rumours of over diluting may be accurate and when they make mistakes - either in billing or filler asymmetry, it‚Äôs all put on the customer. High staff turnover may be a telling sign as well. They used to let me and my daughter have our consultations together but this time didn‚Äôt allow that, I felt they were trying to up sell her so wouldn‚Äôt let me sit in on her consult, seemed sketchy.
Store_reply: Thank you! ‚ù§Ô∏è

Name: Skin Vitality Medical Clinic Toronto
Address: 351 Eglinton Ave W, Toronto, ON M5N 1A3
Review: This was my first time using Botox. Wonderful customer care.  Lovely clinic.    Very pleased with my initial results and extremely thorough, talented nurse injector.   Although, the touch up was with a new injector, mistakes can happen and unfortunately I experienced an asymmetrical, dropped eyebrow and lid with a misshapen eye.  Although this was an extremely difficult experience, the staff was sympathetic, apologetic and  understanding - I was offered a future do-over free of charge as reimbursement.   Accidents happen and we can never be sure the rare wonky face won‚Äôt happen to us (most people who receive Botox injections will experience some degree of asymmetry at some point).   The point is, they rectified the situation as best as was possible with understanding and a high standard of customer care.   There was no fix but to wait for the Botox to wear off and my face to return to normal.   I would recommend asking your injector to carefully read your file and take the time with you to fully understand your needs and desired outcome before beginning - as my first one did.  I believe her name was Tonya?   Perhaps the clinic can confirm.  She‚Äôs the one to ask for!
Store_reply: Thank you! ‚ù§Ô∏è

Name: MedSpa Yonge & Davisville: New You Cosmetic Centres
Address: 1920 Yonge St Suite 107, Toronto, ON M4S 3E2
Review:
The staff here are all extremely friendly, helpful, and honest about what one can expect. They also fully explain aftercare, potential complications, and what are the realistic expectations.

One thing that shows the difference between a good place and one that is less so is when there is an issue. I had a skin reaction from a treatment. The staff here were incredibly helpful with advice, giving me a phone number to text so I could ask questions, wanting photos to see how it was improving, and showed such caring towards me.

If you are considering any of the services they provide, I suggest going here. They stand behind what they do and actually care about their clients. They will go the extra mile for people. They will always do everything they can for people. You can get these things done at many places but not all have the kindness, compassion, and caring that they have at this business. I highly recommend this place. If it is anything like what I have experienced, your trust is well placed here.
Store_reply: Thank you for your detailed and positive feedback, Ryan! We're thrilled to hear that our team provided you with the support and care you needed. It's our priority to ensure a great experience for all our clients, and your recommendation means a lot to us. We look forward to serving you again!

Name: MedSpa Yonge & Davisville: New You Cosmetic Centres
Address: 1920 Yonge St Suite 107, Toronto, ON M4S 3E2
Review:
The company ensures a ‚Äúwelcoming, safe and comfortable‚Äù environment. It was not. They pride themselves in empowering clients and making them feel confident. I left feeling the opposite. Instead I was shamed, blamed and judged.

They lack insight, compassion, empathy, and sensitivity. They failed to establish trust and did not provide opportunities for informed decision making. It‚Äôs evident that their intention is to make a sale. They did not take the time to inquire about my skin care journey, skin care routine, and lifestyle. Instead they pushed TeslaMed on me claiming that it would be the ONLY option for my acne/scarring/fine lines. The cons/complications and failure rates were not disclosed until I asked. The manager said there were no complications‚Ä¶

I was told that I had to commit to 5 treatment for $2000. The manager told me I had to purchase 4+1 complementary treatments for $2000 or else it would be $750 a session. I told her I wanted to do one session at a time because I didn‚Äôt want to commit to something that might not work for me. I was happy to pay $750 each session. She said,  ‚ÄúIs this a cost issue or a trust issue? Lots of people have financial issues these days. I can start an invoice for you for $500‚Äù. I said it was 100% a trust issue.

I chose to bring in my skin care products and medications. The manager never asked me about my regimen over the phone, she did not ask me to bring in my products. I take birth control for endometriosis, and spironolactone for my acne. She said she‚Äôs never heard of spironolactone and asked her colleague to google it. This was surprising because she claims to have ‚Äúbeen in skincare for 23 years‚Äù. Spironolactone is commonly used to control hormonal acne. She kept calling it an antibiotic (which it is not). She looked at my skin care products and said that it was probably good because they were Korean/Japanese products. She did not ask me how or when I used them.

She offered me a complementary trial of TeslaMed. Throughout the treatment the aesthetician gave me advice about healing myself from ‚Äúwithin‚Äù. When I explained my skin concerns she said,  ‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre suffering from something for so long, it manifests inside‚Äù. She then went on about the benefits of an organic diet, Ayurvedic medicine, syncing my treatment according to the placement of the moon, herbal medicine. She also said that because I eat pork I ‚Äúdefinitely‚Äù have parasites ‚Äúpooping and peeing‚Äù inside of me making me crave sweets. She said I should see a homeopath and get a colonic wash. She also said I was retaining fluid in my jaw and needed to do lymphatic exercise everyday. She said I should drink spearmint tea, apple cider vinegar, tumeric and ginger. I should cut out pork and sugar, and eat organic. She then said I need to be happy and stress free. She said I need to stop birth control because I will have issues having kids. She said, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt believe in pills. When I started eating organic and cut out all these things and ayurevedic medicine and treating myself according to the moon my period cramps went away.‚Äù She said if I cut out things slowly I will see a change in my health and my weight.

All of this advice was given without inquiring about my lifestyle, diet, skin care routine, skin care journey. I have been suffering from acne since I was a teen. I‚Äôve been on accutane, different methods of birth control, and skin care regimens. I recently had bloodwork done and my hormone levels are normal. I live an active and healthy lifestyle, and recently lost 40lbs. I am in my 30s and for 2025 I decided to invest in treatment to address my acne scarring/acne/fine lines. I was excited to start this journey but it was ruined by this experience. I will not be coming back and will never recommend this spa to anyone.
Store_reply: We sincerely apologize for your negative experience, Candice. It‚Äôs disappointing to hear that our services did not meet your expectations and that you felt judged and unsupported. Your feedback is invaluable, and we will address these ‚Ä¶ More

Review: Four years ago before Covid I had some Restylane dermal filler injections that gave me a very good lift of my face and lasted for about 3 years or more. This time, in May 2024, I went back to the same place hoping to get the same results. I always have very good experience with the staff at this location, they are friendly, courteous, and efficient. This time the injections were provided by Nasrin who is a super health care professional, originally a dermatologist. She gave me lots of advice and listened attentively to my issues. She was very gentle carefully avoiding all possible blood vessels and even called me back several times to see how the injections were working out for me. I would definitely give her a 5-star rating but nowadays they are using exclusively a German-made filler, called Amalian that does not have very good lifting properties. It is good for filling up places under sagging skin but it didn't give me the desired lift I was hoping for. Nasrin suggested Ion stream 680 treatments for lifting purposes which I might try in the future. My overall experience with this med spa was very good.

Name: MedSpa Yonge & Davisville: New You Cosmetic Centres
Address: 1920 Yonge St Suite 107, Toronto, ON M4S 3E2
Review:
Horrible business practices but the person assigned to me was great.
When I initially purchased my 6 body sculpt, 3 EMS and 2 skin tightening some of those were freebies but they didn't tell me the purchase was non-refundable and charged me before showing me the contract. Then on my first session I was constantly bombarded to upgrade to 12 paddles and now the comments of yeah we can do your goals in 6 paddles during the assessment turned into you need 12 paddles for our vision and this was all within the same day.
I was seeing results but not a lot so I decided to get all my treatments done to get it all over with. I asked to schedule my final session with body sculpt, EMS and skin tightening all in one day and they said yes.Come appointment time they changed my appointment on me and said its just body sculpt because all 3 isn't safe which fine, but why approve it in the first place. I schedule the EMS and skin tightening another time and decided to call them JIC and here's my issue they said my appointment is just for skin tightening and that I only ordered 5 body sculpt, 2 EMS and 2 skin tightening. I raised issues with this and they offered to give me the EMS but honestly decided to just give up the freebie because I don't want to deal with the headache if they decided not to or push for an up-sell or something else on me,I got all 6 of my body sculpt done anyways.
So if you go with them have them issue your contract before paying for anything, have them properly explain the risks and after care and have a picture stating what services you paid for.

Review:
I recently had a very disappointing experience at this spa clinic. My laser services were far below my expectations, and I left every appointment feeling extremely upset. The staff members were consistently rude and condescending towards me, which only added to my frustration.

To make matters worse, the services promised to me were not fulfilled. Despite being told that certain elements of my services would make it less painful, I was refused these options during my appointments. This was particularly frustrating because I had explicitly requested these accommodations and was promised that they would be provided.

Whenever I raised concerns about these issues, someone would promise me a solution that was never fulfilled. It was clear that the staff members did not communicate with each other or keep any records of our conversations. Even though I asked them to document our discussions, I was always met with confusion and frustration.

The final straw came when they tried to charge me for an extra session without being notified beforehand. The staff had not kept track of my  pre-purchased sessions, and I was allowed to come in for an extra session without realizing it would cost me more money. When I was informed of the charge after they performed the services, I felt like I had been deceived and taken advantage of.

Overall, I cannot recommend this spa clinic based on my experience. The poor quality of the services, coupled with the unprofessional behaviour of the staff, left me feeling extremely disappointed and frustrated.
