Name: MedSpa Yonge & Davisville: New You Cosmetic Centres

Review:
This is a long story but here we go; I went in Sept. 2020 for a consultation and ended up purchasing a 5 year unlimited laser hair removal package and charcoal organic teeth whitening treatment (which I didn‚Äôt know was a new product they were trying out). The consultant offer me a discount for a package of 8 since I got the laser package. I was intrigued and went on to pay for both in full. Before my first appointment I found out I was unexpectedly pregnant, I called to see if I could get a refund since I didn‚Äôt know when I was able to start the treatments. They offered to freeze the packages for as long as needed. This past month I went in for my first teeth whitening and was made aware that they no longer have the charcoal whitening product and that this was a rare treatment for them to provide. I felt uncomfortable knowing this but wanted my teeth whitened as I see on Instagram many people get this done with great results. I went ahead and had the treatment with what I think was a product ordered just for my attendance since I complaint about not being able to get the service I paid for and asked for a refund. It did nothing! The manager at the front desk was rude and dismissive when I asked her questions about continuing with the other services. I felt so insulted that I emailed costumer service to tell them I don‚Äôt feel good going back to this location. The other manger (sorry I didn‚Äôt get names) called to inform me she‚Äôs aware that I reached out to costumer service and would like to discuss ‚Äúmy issue‚Äù. When I called back, the office is closed. I tried emailing costumer services and using the message option on their website but no reply. Costumer service is just horrible and I feel really disrespected at this point. I didn‚Äôt start the treatment and all I wanted was a refund for my hard worked money. I have a baby to care for but they don‚Äôt seem to care about that. How can I go to all these appointments with a baby, I can‚Äôt keep getting a sitter. Especially, when the treatments don‚Äôt work.

All I‚Äôm advising is that you turn the other way and visit a different spa. It maybe a little more pricy but worth it at the end. That is if you like being treated with decency. I hope they fix this ‚Äúissue‚Äù as I do plan to reach out to the business bureau or get legal help.

Name: MedSpa Yonge & Davisville: New You Cosmetic Centres
Address: 1920 Yonge St Suite 107, Toronto, ON M4S 3E2
Review:
The Good: helpful staff, clean rooms, great location, flexible schedule, decent prices.

The Bad: Bodisculpt 360 is ineffective.

I spent $9,605 (inc tax) on 18 sessions during a Black Friday sale in 2021. The sales person said this was sufficient for eliminating my bra line fat and for achieving a flat upper & lower abdomen.

After 12 months of sessions, you want to know the result? 0.5mm off the bra line, no change in the upper abdomen, and a 1mm INCREASE in the lower abdomen (from 25mm to 26mm).  My weight decreased by 3.5lbs, but this was due to external factors. I did everything they asked: I exercised regularly, reduced my salt intake, massaged the areas, drank 2L of water every day, accepted 3 complementary sessions, and waited 2 months before coming back to do another round of measurements.

Yes, it's true my fat is extremely stubborn, especially around my waist. (That's why I lost weight without any real fat changes.) But isn't that what body sculpting is for? Their website says "We spent 3 years traveling the world to discover the best technology available", which translates into "we looked for the cheapest machine in Asia that looks fancy."

It was very thoughtful of them to offer 3 free sessions, which is why I'm giving them 3 stars. What I really wanted though was my money back.

Even though the sales person had given me a verbal agreement that I would be satisfied, I was ignorant enough to still sign the digital contract, which clearly states they're not responsible for the results. Now I know why.

So please learn from my very expensive mistake. If you have $10,000 and unwanted fat, this is what you should do instead of spending your money here:
. $4,000 on AirSculpt
. $2,400 on biweekly personal training sessions for 1 year
. $1,200 on a monthly nutritionist
. $2,400 on biweekly therapy. Because if you are gullible enough to believe a beauty clinic salesperson when they say $10,000 of Bodisculpt 360 can remove stubborn fat, then you have deep psychological issues.

Take my advice. Don't end up emotionally and financially miserable like me. I don't think I will ever forgive myself for this.

Address: 1920 Yonge St Suite 107, Toronto, ON M4S 3E2
Review:
I paid more than $1000 per coolsculpting treatment. I Got three coolsculpting treatments done so more than $3500 spent and I don't see any difference in the area I got treated.
It has been 6 months since I got the first treatment done and 2 months since I got the last 3rd treatment done. My last treatment was really bad the machine kept coming out and I had to hold it and when I told that to the nurse she said said "oh really sorry about that". I didn't pay so much money for that response. Then I was offered a free facial which I wasn't much interested in. Because I paid thousands for coolsculpting  not facial. I wanted to see results which I was promised. I hope they will know that its not good to give bad service. I don't know why I got this kind of service. I am just an immigrant in this country and specially during COVID times, it's so hard to earn money. I realize it was my big mistake to just relly on their google reviews and not completely researching if this was the best place to get coolsculpting done. They would schedule my appointment on the day when there was no technician available. I told them I drove 45mins on side to reach them pls book my appointment for all the areas at once and when there is technician. But nope, they got there money and were done with service.
I really wish I get my money back, it was my hard earned money I wasted for NO RESULTS.

Name: MedSpa Yonge & Davisville: New You Cosmetic Centres
Address: 1920 Yonge St Suite 107, Toronto, ON M4S 3E2
Review:
Don't waste your money!
Worst customer service, no commitment, they take zero responsibility of their treatments.
Constantly change of staff and keep no records on your treatments and what they are doing to you.
I was sold their 6 month unlimited package last year for over 7K... the girl was very good to sale it to me while promising services and that I could visit all their locations.
To start, no one was ever able to give me a full list of all services included in my package even after asking multiple times.
I visited other locations since the Yorkville one where I bought my package was too hard for me to get on a weekday appointment. I was literally told not to ever come back in Oakville when I went to try to get my appointments there and was told they didn't even have access to my file nor bothered to look for it to check that I was able to visit all locations.
Appointments were constantly cancelled or rescheduled because their equipment was not working or they mistakenly double booked appointments.
The girl that originally sold me the package was one at some point and no one was able to know what my package included since there was no information in my file other than the amount paid.
Close the the end of my package I asked to speak with the new manager and was even given an appointment which then I realized was not with her but another girl that all she wanted was to sale me more laser sessions because of course I never saw any changes with the 6 sessions I had... I was told that the manager was away in Vegas...
The ONLY ones that I can say were doing a great job and tried to help me were Nadine and Alicia at the Sherway location. Nadine pretty much runs the location on her own.. at least for what I saw and she was amazing. Unfortunately the overal experience was terrible.
Store_reply: Hi Monica, we are very sorry to hear about your experience and the confusion you had with your treatments. Our customizable Ambassador programs are in place for clients to receive unlimited sessions for the services they are interested in ‚Ä¶ More

I called them to book myself and my fianc√© a hydra facial. The lady said you need to pay in advance for it and we cant keep the spot for you.

I highly recommend Fresh Cosmetic to anyone considering cosmetic treatments. Their outstanding service, skilled team, and fantastic results truly set them apart. It is a very busy clinic and the ladies do the best they can to run on time. I‚Äôm usually in and out of there really quickly which is exactly what I‚Äôm looking for.

And the best part is the price. It‚Äôs extremely reasonably priced for both Botox/Dysport and fillers especially when compared to other clinics.

I always get a follow up text from Carol with the next 2 days just checking in to make sure everything is ok, that‚Äôs a nice touch that shows they really care about their clients.

Fresh is my go to, I highly recommend it and I‚Äôll return over and over again.

Name: Fresh Cosmetic Clinic
Address: 132 Atlantic Ave, Toronto, ON M6K 1X9
Review:

The nurse injector Carol is really nice, understanding, and VERY HONEST. She did not get annoyed when I asked about getting my fillers dissolved. She even texted me the following day to see how I was doing. I will definitely come back to get my more things done. The prices are very reasonable for a clinic that is in a salon. The prices are close to what you can get at an at-home- clinic/ mobile clinic. Furthermore, she uses reputable products, so there is nothing to be worried about!

Name: Fresh Cosmetic Clinic

She is wonderful, and what I really value in both Nasrin and Carol is that they care about their clients and never make it all about business and money. They have never pushed me to add more treatments, or want to overdo the injectibles, which has not been my experience in other places.

Name: Canada MedLaser Clinics
Address: 249 Queens Quay W, Toronto, ON M5J 2N5
Review: I went here for facial laser treatment, but unfortunately, I didn‚Äôt see any results. I had six sessions for my face, and now, after a month, all the hair has grown back. When I was considering purchasing their facial laser package, I was told that if I didn‚Äôt get results, they would continue the sessions for free until I saw good results as part of their guarantee. However, when I brought this up, they went back on their word and said that the guarantee only applies to their other packages, not for facial treatments. This was very disappointing because I had seen on their website that they offer a guarantee, and I even double-checked with two of their staff members, both in person and over the phone, before paying the fee, and they confirmed this. But after my third session, when I mentioned that I wasn‚Äôt seeing any results, they didn‚Äôt care and told me to wait until the end of the sessions. Even after six sessions, I still didn‚Äôt see any results, and when I mentioned it to them, they just said it might be a hormonal issue and that they couldn‚Äôt do anything about it. Meanwhile, in other places I‚Äôve had laser treatments, I didn‚Äôt see facial hair for at least seven months. Here, not only did I not see results between sessions (only about 30% of the hair was reduced), but now, after a month, I have full hair regrowth again. It feels really unfair that they lure you in with these promises before you pay, only to change their stance later. Additionally, some of their staff were neither respectful nor professional, and overall, it was a very bad experience for me.

Name: Canada MedLaser Clinics
Address: 249 Queens Quay W, Toronto, ON M5J 2N5
Review: I had a very poor experience at the Queens Quay MedLaser location. I had a consultation appointment for Dysport, and felt pressured by Mabel, the Aesthetician, to make an appointment for the procedure itself despite me communicating that I was wary of proceeding with it. I was not communicated any of the side effects of the procedure during the consultation appointment itself and felt pressured to sign the medical consent forms and book the appointment quickly at the time of the consultation. Only until after the appointment, did I consult with a physician friend to understand that one of the most common side effects include facial weakness that can last up to a month along with blurred vision. After learning this, I called the clinic within 24 hours after I booked the appointment requesting that I cancel my appointment scheduled in two weeks time. I was received with extremely poor customer service whereby three different customer service managers (Margarita, Jessica and Sara) passed my issue along with form emails saying that they would not be able to issue a refund. In each template message, they expressed that they could not issue a refund of my deposit unless I had a physicians note whereby they would only just consider the request for refund. They displayed no accountability for not sharing the most common side effects, along with no empathy or compassion to the circumstances that I described, by which I was pressured to make an appointment at the time of the consultation. The customer service team took no accountability of their role in the situation or the reasonable solution of refunding me my deposit, and instead took a cold and detached approach at interacting with a long-time customers such as myself.

Review: Re. Microneedling. Had the worst experience of my life and I'm still paying for it with spots on my forehead that are raised, pink and itchy after 3 months. Basically someone new did my micro needling, used 1mm (which is the MAX for forehead) on my first session after many years. After it hurt and it bled a lot she LEFT the room a couple of times as she could not take the blood (unsanitary, bad process). Another esthetician came in and basically quickly scrapped the rest of my face, wiped the blood all over my raw face and told me to sleep with it (NOT normal procedure). It took a week for me to be able to go back in to work and I still have raised  inflamed forehead spots where it bled the most. I have shared my experience with the clinic multiple times and asked for a refund of the session and my future session (which is the least they can do) and while they acknowledge the bad experience they felt it was worth keeping my money. Do yourself a favour and go to a clinic run by a dermatologist. This is your FACE.

Name: Canada MedLaser Clinics
Address: 249 Queens Quay W, Toronto, ON M5J 2N5
Review:
My experience at Canada MedLaser was mixed, to say the least. I initially purchased a hair removal package, attracted by the promised results guarantee policy. However, my journey was fraught with inconsistency and frustration.

One of the biggest challenges was booking appointments with the same technician. Due to high demand, it was difficult to secure an appointment every 8 weeks with the same one. This inconsistency led to varying experiences with different technicians, ranging from thorough and attentive to rushed and painful. It was also disappointing to discover that the technicians I preferred no longer worked there, adding to the lack of continuity.

My ultimate disappointment came during my last assessment and appointment. The technician informed me of the 70% hair removal guarantee, which came as a surprise as I had not been previously informed. Despite this, I agreed to the two additional complimentary sessions she offered to address remaining hair growth. However, during the first of these sessions, the technician abruptly declared my hair was gone, contradicting her previous assessment and leaving me confused and unsatisfied.

The entire appointment was marred by the technician's negative and passive-aggressive demeanour, making me feel unwelcome and uncomfortable. While I typically avoid confrontation, the unprofessionalism displayed during this session was unacceptable.

Overall, while I did see results from the sessions, the inconsistency in service quality and the disappointing conclusion to my experience left me with no desire to return for the final complimentary session or to Canada MedLaser in the future.
Store_reply: Hello! Unfortunately, we cannot find your name or any appointments that reflect your alleged purchases in our system. ‚Ä¶ More

Name: Canada MedLaser Clinics
Address: 249 Queens Quay W, Toronto, ON M5J 2N5
Review:
Glad to see all the good reviews, unfortunately it wasn't a great experience for me. I had laser hair removal treatment here a few years ago. I signed up for 18 months but only completed about 12 due to being burned badly. The service was great until my 12th treatment, they increased the power of the laser and i was burned so bad all over the front of my chest and stomach I nearly needed to go to the hospital I was in so much pain. I received an email the next day with an apology for burning me which was great, but months and years later no follow up after that to see if I had healed. The doctor never reached out at all. I was just forgotten about. I'm sure I'm just the unlucky one as i see there are lots of great reviews for this place on google but thought I should let people know my experience.

Edit: Response to below
- I was not slightly tanned
-The laser was increased not decreased
-A thorough explanation was not given to me for treatment.
-I had no follow up visits after being burned by the laser
-I was not contacted several times about my recovery.

I felt valued up until the multiple burns, thank you for your time. I appreciate your response.
Store_reply:
Hi Troy,

Thank you for your review.  We appreciate all feedback, positive and negative to ‚Ä¶ More

Name: Skin Society Bar
Address: 60 St Clair Ave E #102, Toronto, ON M4T 1N5
Review:
Did I find this place because of a TikTok ad.
Yes.
Do I regret it?
Not one bit!

I had this place saved for a month because it's quite the commute from my area, but I went yesterday and y'all, the experience is something else!

The waiting area has comfy soft chairs, a little contest going on, a bowl of wrapped dark chocolate, and a friendly receptionist who will offer you water (maybe it's because my skin was crying for moisture üòÖ)

I had Dawn's do my initial consultation.

And instead of the 1 second finger poke to your cheek, like some places do, they have a whole machine that checks different spots on your face and assess your skin's age.

Afterward, Dawn explained what I'd have to do in a general sense, and then she asked if I had time to do a treatment that day.

Key words, she asked.

I wasn't pushed a product or an expensive treatment right off the bat.

Then she talked about 1 thing to try today that my skin would benefit from.

I forgot what it was called, but I think it was an oxygen hydrating facial thing (not one of the ones on promo) and when it was over I was glowing more than I had been the whole month!

Then, and only after that, when I asked what I should do next, that's when she suggested other services, packages, and products.

I felt encouraged but not pressured.

I also liked the custom reasoning of why this and not that.

Lastly, they do keep track of your progress with pictures if you permit.

Hands down best place, they actually care about your skin more than your wallet, and are so chill that I will obviously be back.
Store_reply: Thank you for your lovely review and feedback, Leeann. We are grateful you enjoyed every minute of your time here. ‚Ä¶ More

Name: Skin Society Bar

I would give 0 stars if possible. My experience at this clinic was horrendous, largely due to Roni, their Customer Service Manager. I initially booked a hydro facial with a promo but was later informed that the appointment was canceled due to a misunderstanding about a deposit link that expired before I could use it. The booking receptionist had told me to "take my time" with the link, but I wasn‚Äôt informed it had a 20-minute expiration.

When I called to clarify, Roni‚Äôs response was combative. She argued about what the receptionist had said and insisted she would review the recorded call, which felt unnecessary. Roni‚Äôs aggressive and argumentative demeanor caused me significant stress, particularly since I am five months pregnant. She kept me on the phone for nearly 10 minutes, focusing more on proving me wrong than finding a solution.

At the rebooked appointment, Roni had intercepted the appointment and pulled me over to the reception area, where she publicly accused me of having used the promo before, despite my statements that I didn‚Äôt recall doing so. Roni's aggressive behavior led to a 30-minute confrontation that left me physically and emotionally distressed, as I was shaking and sweating from the stress. She disregarded my explanations and continued to argue, ultimately pushing me toward a more expensive treatment.

Roni‚Äôs lack of empathy and judgment created a humiliating and unpleasant experience. Her actions not only affected me but also made the situation uncomfortable for other staff and clients. This clinic‚Äôs potential is marred by poor customer service and management. I strongly advise avoiding this place.

Name: Skin Society Bar

Review: I went here after taking a deal on Instagram for Beauty Boost Facial. Supposed to be 1 hour and was asked to come a bit early for consultation. I was on time and Dawn went over my skin texture and issues that needed to be addressed in long term. Dawn was polite and friendly. The consultation lasted 20 minutes with scanning done on my skin and having AI detect the dryness level. The facial lasted 25 minutes with 15 minutes hands on and 10 minutes LED therapy and face massage. I felt rushed and it did not satisfy me because my face still did not feel freshened or rejuvenated. I did feel hydrated for sometime. After my session, the receptionist offered some services that were on a deal only if I would buy them on the spot! They were quite a few $$$ and one needs mental preparation and research before buying a service that is going to be provided in future. I did not purchase anything more and left. Overall I felt more time should have been spent on the facial part. However, the ambience is relaxing!

Not too big just a nice plump while still looking natural.

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown

During my first visit to Clinique De Mode I received a HydraFacial and Botox consultation; both done by Dr. Natalie MacPherson. I‚Äôve had a HydraFacial done elsewhere before but the one here at Clinique de mode was the best thus far! It was relaxing and my skin was glowing for days!

During my second visit, I had Botox done (for my very first time) by Natalie and it went so smoothly. My results are amazing.

The staff at Clinique De Mode are all so friendly, patient, and very well-versed in their field. Each visit was pleasant and informative. I also love the decor and how light and airy the clinic feels. It‚Äôs just the perfect place for all your self care needs.
Store_reply: Hey Erica! Wow. Thank you so much for taking the time to write such an incredibly kind and detailed review. We really appreciate you, and we'll always strive to ensure that each time you visit us your experience will always be better than the last. Thank you so much for the support. See you again soon xo

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown

Review: Came here for a hydra facial. Staff was very friendly and did an excellent job at explaining each and every step. Highly recommend!

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review:
The staff at Clinique De Mode are friendly, but unfortunately, I did not receive the level of professionalism or results I was expecting from the Forma facial I had there. I have been getting Forma treatments at another clinic in Toronto for a few years, and when Clinique De Mode opened a location near me, I decided to give it a try.

I visited a week before my wedding, and the nurse suggested doing Forma on my forehead. This had never been recommended at my previous clinic, as they advised against it due to the skin being too thin. However, the nurse at Clinique De Mode assured me that it was safe, so she proceeded. Toward the end of the treatment, it became uncomfortably hot, and I had to ask her to stop. She reassured me that this was normal, but I left with a red spot on my forehead, which turned into a scar two days later.

I contacted the clinic to inform them of what happened, and they responded by downplaying my concern, stating that the mark was just hyperpigmentation and would eventually fade. They even offered to provide scar cream, which seemed contradictory if it was supposedly only hyperpigmentation.

I'm leaving this review because, two months later, the scar is still there. While the staff at Clinique De Mode were courteous, I don't believe they demonstrated the level of knowledge and professionalism that customers expect. Based on my experience, I would not recommend getting Forma treatments here.

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown

Review: Such a friendly and knowledgeable staff!! I‚Äôve been for a number of treatments; always a great experience. 10/10. üñ§ ‚Ä¶

I had previous done so many facial with iS clinical products and even biologique recherche but nothing compares to the results from the chemical peel Natalie has done for me. It burns but the results are so worth the minor discomfort. Can‚Äôt wait to continue treatment here!

EDIT: no one ever called to follow up.

Hesitated on writing this review, but ultimately decided it can help others. I got a hydrafacial gold with Darlene the other day and I wish I hadn‚Äôt. The treatment seemed to go fine until she added Phloretin cf at the end. That product is drying due to the denatured alcohol, irritating to many based on reviews, and should never be used on someone who she agreed had dry/dehydrated skin. I used it years ago and got a bad reaction, and mentioned it after she applied it, and she said it would be okay as opposed to washing it off. Unfortunately, it caused the same reaction that started as I was going home, and just days before a vacation I was so excited about. After such an exfoliating facial, l-ascorbic acid which doesn‚Äôt agree with everyone shouldn‚Äôt be used especially on a first time client. I also felt leaving the peel on for 2 minutes was quite long, especially knowing I used retinol 3-5 days prior. She was very nice, but I feel someone more experienced would not have done certain things. Just something to keep in mind for the future.
Store_reply: Hi Tanisha. We appreciate your feedback. Darlene‚Äôs actually at our CDM Midtown Location (this is CDM Downtown) but we‚Äôll definitely forward this info over to them. We‚Äôre sorry to hear that your experience wasn‚Äôt to your full satisfaction. One of our team members will follow up to discuss your visit in more detail. Thank you.

Review:
I had a traumatic experience from a skin spa recently, where they pinpointed all my imperfections on my face and body while I was doing a HydraFacial in order to sell their other services + products. Going through that was totally worth it in the end because that lead me to trying out Clinique De Mode.
The staff here are so genuine. During my first visit, they told me HydraFacial is actually not suitable for my skin at the moment and suggested me a different procedure through solid reasoning. Vance and Sarah are both amazing at what they do and extremely easy going! Shoutout to Kerrie as well, she is a gem. She made me feel so welcomed at the front desk in all of my visits. I guess I showed a bit of insecurities; she reminded me every time that it is not as bad as how I look at myself in the mirror + it takes time. I also appreciate how she told me that what products work for her would not necessarily work for me.
The sad reality is that most skin spas undervalue how important a comfortable setting is for customers. I almost forgot what it was like to not be pestered during a treatment until I came here.
Clinique De Mode executes comfort so well and understand the importance of specialized skincare for different individuals (not blindly- suggesting products without knowing anything about the ingredients). I walk-out feeling better about myself thanks to their wonderful staff, and I can't wait to continue my clear-skin journey with them!

Review:
I was curious about a skin basic treatment. The first issue I had with this place was them asking for a credit card for a free consult. I politely debated this with the person on the phone and they finally let me book without a card on file. I've been the victim of identity theft so I am perhaps I'm a little more sensitive than others.

I had completed the COVID questionnaire online before my appointment but I hadn't completed their medical history form.  I was asked to provide my medical history in their data system including who my physician was and other personal information. I was prepared to discuss relevant basics about my health so they could appropriately answer my questions but I definitely felt their ask for all my information even before a basic consult was an overreach. She tried to justify the ask by saying it was regulatory and then by saying it was for contract tracing. They already had my name and phone number, which is all any business has needed to contact tracing. The other (well regarded) place I went to for a consult did not demand all this data to answer a few simple questions. And no, this doesn't mean the other place was any less thorough, they asked plenty of questions about my health but didn't demand it be entered into their system first. I left Clinique Du Mode without getting any of my simple questions answered. Their competition will be getting my business. Imagine, giving your credit card info, home, and medical information to a business and all before even becoming a customer. No thanks.

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review:
I didn‚Äôt realize you weren‚Äôt allowed to review an establishment only once.
What if your next experience was even better?

What if it‚Äôs been a while and you noticed big changes?
Well, I‚Äôm editing my Clinique De Mode review  because the past few years haven‚Äôt been easy on businesses. So I‚Äôll review my latest experience.

With so many changes occurring at a rapid pace.
Some things have remained calm, relaxing and dependable. Clinique De Mode is one of them.
Being voted Toronto‚Äôs #1. Medical Spa, two years running‚Ä¶with Year Three on the way is well deserved!
A lot goes into receiving such an award and we are incredibly lucky to have one of their locations in Leslieville.

I‚Äôve reviewed Clinique De Mode before, yet I felt the need to give them some love again.
To me, one of the most important positions in any establishment is always your first point of contact. Whether it be via phone, email or face to face.

Client Care is of utmost importance. You want to feel cared about and welcomed, no matter what your visit is for.

Was the experience warm? Did you feel calm & unhurried?
Was the environment as hygienic feeling as we feel the need for right now? (It was just as hygienic pre-covid btw)

Do they offer fantastic products at attainable costs?
Not make you feel pressured into purchasing skincare products at the end of your visit
Are Skin Treatments being provided by technicians whom have attained the most up to date knowledge, certification and skills?!?

Are they able to provide ALL of this coupled with that warmth, professionalism and constancy we deserve as well? Is that possible?!??

The answer is yes. 100%!
Clinique De Mode has consistently provided all of this and more since my first experience there five years ago.

I‚Äôm not a monthly client. Yet my experience has always felt personal with my technician.
They always know what took place the last time I visited.
I‚Äôve never once felt ‚Äúless than‚Äù for not having the means to come in on a schedule (I would so love to one day!! üòä)

They provide specials every few months and unlike so many medical spa‚Äôs, their promotions are fresh and attainable.

Meaning I may have wanted to try this or that with my skincare regime.
I couldn‚Äôt commit to a package & here‚Äôs a promotion that will let me see some results if I try it.

Clinique De Mode is not a fast food chain. They are a caring, highly professional team that certainly don‚Äôt need to make a buck off of you.
They genuinely care about your skin, but also your experience. They‚Äôre a part of our community.
It‚Äôs a swanky li‚Äôl place! It‚Äôs a boutique but you could almost envision a cozy fireplace.

Here‚Äôs to another deserved ü•á

Clinique de Mode is fabulous all around. From the patient Care Coordinators to the Clinicians, everyone is extremely friendly, accommodating and welcoming.
They offer the most up to date services in the cleanliest environment, performed by highly qualified professionals.
They always go out of their way to accommodate you and they aren‚Äôt about making money off of you or up-selling you on products or services. They are extremely respectful and honest.
I wouldn‚Äôt go anywhere else for services anymore and highly recommend everyone gives them a try. You won‚Äôt be disappointed and you‚Äôll keep going back üòä

I will most definitely return... cant wait

Thanks Christina!

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review:
Christina is kind, caring and honest. I came in for a consultation for a number of services and she walked me through the science behind each treatment. She recommended I not proceed with a few services that were unnecessary or offered too much in the way of maintenance and made me feel
Comfortable to ask a number of questions.

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review: I have struggled with acne since my teenage years and have significant scarring due to it, so have been looking for ways to improve their appearance for ages. Clinique De Mode was top of my list, and I was not disappointed! Kerrie did an amazing job with my Fractora laser resurfacing, and an incredible job with my hydrafacial following my recovery. My skin looks the best it has ever looked! Definitely recommend!

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review: This place is so lovely. The staff are super friendly and professional. The treatments are stellar, and the space is always spotless. I leave feeling well cared for, and looking forward to my next appointment.

Review: I absolutely loved my hydrafacial experience at Clinque De Mode. I have had a few hydrafacials elsewhere and this by far was the best. This new intimate skin boutique is owned by a very nice couple. I have already reccommended a few friends and they love it. Highly recommend this place!

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review: My experiences with Clinique De Mode have been very pleasant.  They are a very professional, warm welcoming, informative and helpful!  I like that it is a small clinic and very clean and well organized.

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review: I'm always so happy with my services at CDM. The staff and the technicians are so friendly and knowledgeable. They always make you feel welcome and comfortable.
Store_reply: Thanks for the kind review Megan. See you again soon <3

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review:
I can't say enough positive things about how amazing Christina, the clinic and the facials are at Clinique De Mode.

Firstly, clinic co-owner Christina is beyond lovely. She genuienly cares about her clients, their goals and truly wants you to see results. She has always greeted me with a warm welcome and offers a coffee or water before treatment begins. I've never been made to feel rushed (which has happened to me at other clinics) and instead feel like I'm being invited into someone's home.

Second, the clinic itself is beautiful. You can tell the moment you walk in that a lot of care went into the design of the space. It's clean, full of natural light and is filled with top of the line skin care gadgets that I've never seen before. You really get the sense that you're getting the best of the best at Clinique De Mode.

Last, the facials at Clinique WORK. I have long battled with adult acne and have spent countless amounts of money on products, procedures, specialists etc. and nothing ever worked for me until I went for a hydrafacial at Clinique De Mode. I immediately saw results after my first facial (I've only been twice) and am happy to share that my skin is 100% acne free!!!

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review: Absolutely love Christina and the results I‚Äôm getting at Clinique de Mode. I‚Äôve been making the over an hour drive to her spa since it opened. Her space is beautiful and welcoming. Christina is highly professional nurse injector.

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown

Review: They are very kind and helpful and no painüòÖthank you! ‚Ä¶

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown

Review: A 5 Star Spa! I have been a customer for over a year having done several different treatments. The staff are extremely friendly and very knowledgeable. They take the time to answer your questions and discuss available options. A very relaxing environment. Always look forward to my next treatment. Highly recommend this place!

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review: Cristina and staff are amazing! Warm, welcoming, professional, knowledgable with the highest quality treatments and products. Hands down the best clinic I have visited in Toronto, and I am not an easy customer. Thank god I found this gem üíé

Name: Clinique De Mode | Downtown
Address: 211 Yonge St, Toronto, ON M5B 2H1
Review:
There are so many places in the city of Toronto to get skin treatments, so why the hell would you go all the way to Broadview and Queen to get Laser Hair Removal, Microneedling or Botox?

I will tell you why - Christina and her staff, including husband Steven are absolutely fabulous.

You won't feel like just a number when you walk into Clinique de Mode,  you will feel like you are having a fabulous relaxing experience.     From the moment you walk in until you sadly don't need to go back for your appointments and have to say sad goodbyes, you will absolutely love your treatments, conversations and the overall experience at Clinique de Mode.

Thank you Christina for having the best spot in the city for skin treatments and all our wonderful chats.  I don't do many reviews but I highly, highly, highly recommend Clinique de Mode xoxo
